reviews.text: Great place to go relax and have some fun. The offer food and select drinks. Now serving alcohol. Kinda pricey but to be expected.

RV park located just a stone's throw away from 30 mile bike path that wraps around the lake and a truly beautiful beach with post card like views. Free to walk in. Water in July was super warm. Beach sand is soft with only a few spots that show a bit of gravel. Water is quite shallow anywhere near shore making it kid friendly swimming. 3-5 Lifeguards on duty. Select food and drink available at small concessions area. Alcohol served in small but pleasant tiki patio. Just minutes to downtown Burlington with all of its charm. Many shops and restaurants to visit. This place is a hidden gem. It's not crowded. We are going to return soon!
A phenomenal landscape and well-kept place all right for all visitors in native Florence

Kayaking (rentals)  in the light waves was an experience and not that hard.   Great beach with relatively shallow for long distances.   Less than a foot for a while 5 or so feet deep at max.   Awesome picnic areas.  Clean changing and bath rooms...outdoor showers and decent snack shack.

Superb park, has everything you could want in an outdoor experience. The water does not get too warm in Vt, but you can't complain about that. Clean facilities and a nice snack bar. Bring your sand umbrella.

Beautiful beach, clean clear water. The beach was super busy and full of tourists, they have a restaurant and bar near the beach you can go to as well as massage tables right on the beach. Really nice place!
There is a boardwalk that we watched the sunset from every night, where the waves come in from two different directions what a piece of paradise this island is
Beach and waterfront nearly perfect, but because of it ease to find - kind of always crowded...
It's very busy and festive. They had music for a couple days which was nice. Lots of shops and the white sand beach is right there

Also referred to as Playa Central. The beach is super wide but drops off quickly once it enters the water- so it's kind of the reverse of Playa Norte (narrower beach, but can walk hundreds of feet out into the water without much depth/sub aquatic vegetation). This beach can get extremely crowded, so I like it best in the early morning (tour boats start arriving around noon with droves of people) and at sunset and for night time star gazing.

Went for breakfast.  I had cascades and Kim had French toast.  Both were very good.  Tequila sunrise were good as well. The staff were as nice as could be.  Go to this place.  You will be glad that you did.

Great!!!!! Had breakfast here and it was delicious and authentic, exactly what I was looking for and they made me an amazing ice coffee. I’m sure dinner and drinks are just as great.. will be back next time in town.

This was one of the first places I ate at a few years ago. I revisited it this evening and it was simply the best. A little hidden spot right on the main Avenue.  I had the garlic shrimp. Cooked perfect and the staff was excellent. I'm having dinner tomorrow evening while h is my last night on the island. I'm getting my pizza before I leave.

The salt fish is about as good as you can get.  Baked in a cocoon of salt, it is always cooked perfectly.  Order the day before, so they can get the perfect fresh fish for you.  

Other entrees are very good also, but salt fish is exceptional.  BTW, it is not salty at all.  In fact you may need to add a little salt to taste.

Amazing food, amazing service...definitely 
 recommend.

My wife had the Mexican fish, I the garlic shrimp.  The garlic shrimp was good.  My wife stated the Mexican fish was a C- at best.  The med. margaritas were big, but no taste or alcohol.  Our bill came to 880 pesos.  If we would have ordered the Lobster for 2 @ 1190 pesos. I think we would have been much happier.  Live and learn.  Enjoying our stay in Isla!

Never written a review before but we were an inconvenience to the servers day. The least enthusiastic welcome I’ve ever received walking into a restaurant. Asked if we wanted medium or small cocktails. The ones on the menus were 90 pesos. We said medium - could only be described as jumbo cocktails (jumbo juices probably more accurate - zero alcohol). They served me the wrong cocktail. Didn’t seem interested in changing it to the right one. Overall, terrible service, v average food and terrible drinks !
We go here every time we are on the island. Best fish tacos.  Good service.  Great view. Drinks are huge
Great food out on the wharf! You have to look for it though. Located behind the Pemex out on the dock. It is easy to miss it if you were walking by
The coconut shrimp was incredible! Not like any coconut shrimp I have ever had! Perfectly cooked and covered in shredded coconut and crispy breading. Delicious!
I tried for the first time their Chicken Flautas with the green sauce. Nicely plated, lightly deep-fried, with a sprinkle of lettuce and cheese. They were simply delicious!
I was surprised the enchilada with green sauce were fried ( chicken and cheese) but they were fabulous. Great price!
Great location and friendly staff. Make sure you introduce yourself to Freddy if he's there fantastic guy.
Was $4 for 3 tacos and a beer! Pretty good price, other place i ate for the same meal charged $8
best food on the island, mindy, fredy and their family are the greatest 🤙🏼

Just went there with my wife and the food/service was awesome. Probably the best shrimp tacos I’ve ever had (and I’ll ever have). Waiter was super nice. Will definitely be going back before we head back home.
Best mix ceviche(conch & 🦐) on the island ...
Not much to look at but the food, service and drinks were first rate. Great value as well.

Fresh fish, fast service from this traditional Mexican restaurant. Amazing deep fried coconut shrimp, grilled red snapper and shrimp / conche cerviche were world class. Go for the small portion, the medium was huge. Loved it.
The Ceviche here was awesome! My husband had the Fish Veracruz's it was also tasted. Large portions great value for your money. Very attentive service!!!

Italian Original with a sea breeze. It’s right there on the Ocean. A Cozumel original that still delivers great Italian food. Warm attentive service. Hang outside on the Oceanside patio. Don’t miss the bomba bread.

Great place if only they would lower their prices.  I never see this place full of people.  Perfect place for seeing the sea. Open air but $50 us for a dinner for 3 is perhaps the most expensive on the island. 
Wish I could say generous portions but left the table not satisfied unless I filled up with bread...ouch!

Great steak cooked to perfection!
Beautiful sunsets.
Fast and Friendly service.

Great place for sunsets! They have a small deck you can walk onto and take some pics where you are not in the way of people eating.

Food was good, but not amazing.  I would still go again because the restaurant had a good vibe, view & service. 

Garlic bread - is actually garlic pizza. It was average and wouldn't order it again 

Fettuccine with prawns (creamy red sauce based) - sauce was tasty and prawns were good. Pasta was a little tough (but didnt ruin the meal)

Pizza - was tasty and good cheese

Tiramisu- not that much flavour. Wouldn't recommend.

I would still go back to this place; food was still tasty - just did not have the wow factor :)
As usual the food was outstanding.  Service great. We have been going to rolandi's since the 90's, it has been a family tradition. So delicious.

Low key. Super friendly staff. Local. Not touristy. I had a couple Sincronizadas. My girlfriend had some tacos. 65-85 pesos for three tacos depending on meat. Sincronizadas were about the same. Great food. Beers were 30 pesos. It was our last day but we would definitely eat there again. Cash only.
This place was absolutely amazing! The guacamole is great, and tacos are cheap and tasty. Very affordable compared to many other restaurants on the island.

This place is incredible!! Authentic Mexican food and the NICEST waiters. So friendly and sweet. We LOVED everything about this place. We had a cute little table on the street. We saw tons of locals eating here and I loved that! Highly recommend!

We loved this place. If you’re vegan or vegetarian, don’t be deterred by the menu. They make great veggie tacos with mushrooms, beans and other good stuff. The nachos are also amazing. The staff are super nice and are happy to accommodate. Lots of locals go there so it’s a nice, lively place in the evenings.
Great food, great service and great prices! Quiet and casual mid island taqueria.
